question: Core Investment Company holds not less than 90 per cent of its net assets in the form of investment in which of the following?
explanation: Core Investment Company (CIC) is a non-banking financial company carrying on the business of acquisition of shares and securities and which (a) holds not less than 90 per cent of its net assets in the form of investment in equity shares, preference shares, bonds, debentures, debt or loans in group companies,
